ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great Course. Good topics. Final project is a good assignment.
This is a course that all students who are very keen on applied mathematics and quantitative finance should take.

I feel like I learned more in this class than in any other class I've taken at Yale. I hadn't used R before taking this class, and now I feel pretty comfortable using R for data analysis. I also learned a lot of techniques (ARCH, GARCH, copulas, VaR, etc.) that I had never heard of before this class. Further, the lectures built on a lot of what we learned in previous econometrics classes, so I feel more confident about that material as well. Lastly, it was nice that the final assignment was a research paper.
